title: Stop saying "ggez"
body:
It's not about me being oversensitive. It's not about how toxic the phrase is. It's just shit sportsmanship. This is a sport. If ever someone said this after an MLB game, you can bet there would be a bench clearing brawl that results from it. Just because you're a coward that can only confront people from the anonymity of your keyboard doesn't give you the right to be a shit person. Stop with this cancer. NOW.




Edit: for all the people who keep saying that GGEZ is fine because it's not punishable:

>While it’s alright to celebrate, make sure that you keep any gloating (or any other mode of self-indulgence) out of all chat.  

Straight from the Summoner's Code. It's punishable.

Your definition is extremely loose. These _post_ are what's cancer. You find something that isn't necessarily good and try to turn it into an exclusively evil thing. Being as how that's the nature of the these post you asign values of 'good' and 'evil' to both sides of this discussion. Those that agree with the main point are instantly labelled and 'good'. Those that try to oppose the main point are instantly labelled as 'evil' or in laymans terms 'toxic'. It doesn't matter how good you try to be in game and uphold sportsman ship. It doesn't matter how much effort and thought you put into a point as long as it opposes the 'x is bad' mentality whatever you're saying will be shunned. In a similar fashion, loosely thought out comment like what you have written here will be agreed with on sight. Doesn't matter how little thought is put into it. It doesn't matter what actually thinking about the details actually shows the true meaning entails it will just be labelled as good, upvoted bombed and everything against it will downvoted either to attempt to piss off the other side or in an attempt to make the original message of the post correct without opposition.

There are toxic people who oppose this. But in the same light there are also non-toxic people who oppose this because your reactions are extremely overboard and dissagree with the 'league is a sport and should be treated like one' mentality. They are not saying that that the game should deteriorate into a state where everyone can be complete dicks to each other but it's more along the lines of its a game so they would rather it not be as restricted as a sport, no, a _professional_ sporting setting as often times people try to equate it to some Major League Baseball game but the thing is at the very least _half_ of the people playing the game see it as a video game. If they wanted a sports setting they'd probably be play FIFA, NBA or NFL games.

Even if you were correct with your personal definition of sport (which is not the only one there is), this is a semantic argument at best, because things that apply to sports may still very well apply to E-sports.
The simple fact that it is called e-sports implies that certain concepts can be easily transferred from sports to e-sports.

If you believe a concept **can't** be transferred from e-sports to sports, then use that specifically as your argument instead of relying on a pointless semantic argument that entirely depends on which definition of a word you are referring to.

If by "easier" you mean less physical exertion, then yes, I agree. But the skills required to be good at baseball are much more difficult to learn and require much more precision in their execution.

Look, an engine could mean Diesel engine, a card and birthday card should be specified, and you would say apple tree if you could obviously see damn apples on it.

"Hey I want to go show you my tree outside!" - it's a fucking tree why do I want to see it? Oh wait, an apple tree? Maybe we could pick some apples, or some other shit!

Look, e-sports are called e-sports because it's electronic - which means it doesn't take athleticism. Which is what sports require. This isn't thE NBA or NHL, it's a video game, yes it does share similar things such as competitiveness, a competitive scene, a win-loss, etc but e-sports does not take moving around, has different banter ("gg ez" let's say), and overall differences which make it an *E*-sport and not a sport

Cancer is not by any means an inappropriate word nor is it a curse word, ergo there is nothing wrong with using it in this capacity. Also, as a survivor of cancer, I will use the word however the fuck I want, thanks.
Glaring hypocrisy. If you want to use cancer to describe things you don't like, then why should anyone listen to you when you tell them not to say ggez?

Check definition 3. I'll post it here just in case you're too unwilling to be proven wrong:

>something evil or malignant that spreads destructively

And there is literally no hypocrisy here. I am using a word as it is intended to be used to describe a behavior that is malignant (malevolent or infectious in nature) and spreads very easily (ie it tilts others who in turn end up being toxic in future games). This is LITERALLY how the disease cancer works, which is why this more colloquial definition exists in the first place.
Comparing ggez to cancer is absolutely donkey balls up the ass ridiculous, but hey you're a cancer survivor.
